page.title: 08BREAKDANCING IN MURSTON
page.content: { } Breakdance is the latest dance craze from the United States of America and it is very popular amongst the child- ren of Murston. It dates from 1975 and is a development from bodypopping which is a form of street dancing. A group of breakdancers is called a crew and the Murston children belong to various local crews, with such exotic names as Tec Tronic, Freeze Force and Time Zone. There is a great rivalry between the local groups and their impromptu competitions are called burns. Our school has banned breakdancing from the playground because of accidents. The loud music played in the streets often brings complaints from local residents. This is a pity because breakdancing is just good fun. A competition was held at Murston Junior School's May Fair.
